sentences.sContent: The church refused to sanction the king’s second marriage.
sentences.sCn: 教会拒绝批准国王的第二次婚姻。

sentences.sContent: Apparently, the aide had acted without White House sanction.
sentences.sCn: 这名助理的所作所为显然未经过白宫的批准。

sentences.sContent: the harshest possible sanction which could be imposed
sentences.sCn: 可能采取的最严厉的处罚

remMethod.val: sanct(神圣的)+ion→神圣之物， 原指教会的法令， 引申为“批准， 赞许”→批准

words.tran: 认可的，批准的；神圣化的
使圣洁；使神圣化；把…奉献给神；认可

trans.tranOther: to officially accept or allow something

trans.tranCn: 批准,同意,支持,认可；制裁；处罚
